row.AboutMe:
Hi, I'm not really a person.

I'm a background process that helps keep this site clean!

I do things like

  • Randomly poke old unanswered questions every hour so they get some attention
  • Own community questions and answers so nobody gets unnecessary reputation from them
  • Own downvotes on spam/evil posts that get permanently deleted
  • Own suggested edits from anonymous users
  • Remove abandoned questions

Full-time Internet. Gamer. Developer at Stack Exchange.

Formerly a community manager and elected moderator on Stack Overflow/Programmers Stack Exchange.

Email me and tell me something interesting: anna@stackexchange.com.

Briefing

With six years of professional experience, and a solid Java full-stack background, I'm currently mostly focused on front-end.

Recently, I'm strongly working with AngularJs, Less, and Material Design, and I hope to discover and share more knowlegde on these topics.

Wishlist

Unfortunately, I haven't played with some other front-end technologies yet, but I'm also looking forward about well established technologies:

SASS, Stylus, Foundation, Compass-CSS, ES6, CoffeeScript, 6to5, RequireJs, EmberJs, BackboneJs, ReactJs, MEAN stack, Bower, Grunt, Gulp, Sonar, Jenkins, Karma, Protractor, SauceLabs, Mocha, Chai, Sinon, PhantomJs, Jasmine, QUnit, Jade, and Mustache.
English is not my main Language, feel free to edit any of my English posts to fix any kind of mistakes I make on them :)

Hello, my name is Hugo Sales; I pretend to be a CG artist and Programmer, but mostly fail :(. I live in Portugal and, thus, speak Portuguese as my native language; I also speak Spanish and English. I can code in Java, Lua, Python, C++ and Rust.

I picked up Blender in version 2.64 RC1, and have "used" (read downloaded) every major version since.

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/r+or+matlab+or+stata+or+sas+or+statistics+or+algorithm ^ a saved search for my own use...

Huzzah: 12th to get the bronze data.table badge!

I am a software developer, who also happens to have a great many other interests in life. One of them is linguistics (and languages in general). My native language is Portuguese and, at the moment, I'm commited to the Portuguese Language & Usage proposal. If you love that language and admire its tradition as much as I do, please commit to it and be part of a great lusophone community!

C / C++ PHP (OOP) Java ASP.NET (C#) Asp Classic (Vbscript)

xml / xslt / rss Javascript SEO ActionScript (AS3.0) mobile

I am an apprentice programmer in many of its meanings, and I am a master of none :)

Portuguese software developer coding his way through fields with various shades of green and brown.

Iniciei no mundo da programação aos 18 anos, em fevereiro de 2013, como estagiário de desenvolvimento web. Aprendi PHP e JQuery de forma autodidata após o técnico em Informática. Hoje trabalho com Tritium, uma linguagem utilizada para em um framework front-end da Moovweb.

Freelance musician & webdesigner. I work with music & JavaScript most. Appart from that I have some other languages I am fluent in.

Community Manager for Stack Exchange since June 2015. Lover of all things sharp including pencils, wit, and knives but not cheddar.

You can email me here: jgarza@stackoverflow.com

Linkedin, para visualizar meu perfil profissional.

Desenvolvedor c#, java, android, e web(Client: javascript, html5, css3 e jquery para agilizar ou ainda angularjs para organizar e agilizar nosso tão castigado client-side; Server: asp.net-mvc, nodejs).

Prefiro ORM's (nhibernate, fluent-nhibernate, hibernate, jpa) do que SQL (Motivos: Produtividade, facilidade de refatoração e manutenção, mas penso que é necessário conhecer bem o sql gerado pelos ORM's, senão todos os motivos se invertem), mas em "últimos casos" não há problema em uma linda consulta nativa (viram a enfase em "últimos casos"?).

Entusiasta e aberto a novas abordagens e tecnologias.

Conhecendo atualmente: angularjs, nodejs, windows-phone, mongodb, ios, backbone, games, gideros - Exatamente nessa ordem de prioridades.

Stack Exchange employs me as a Community Manager. I've been known to respond to jericson@stackexchange.com. Alternatively, I maintain an office on chat. (Please ignore the meta cruft.)

I write about my experience as a community manager at jericson.github.io. You can read about what I've done over the years in my curriculum vitae.

On a personal note, I'm married and have three children. Our oldest son loves school, friends, games, and reading. (He can't wait to get on our LEGO® Answers site, but he's not quite old enough. My posts there are usually at his request.) Two of my children happen to have been born on the same day. I sometimes write about that experience.

Don't have time for a full review of something? Why not try my 5-second reviews?

Occasionally, I write a post for Eschewmenical.

Informe seu perfil aqui se quiser que eu recomende competências baseado nas tags que você tem boa reputação.

Siga-me no Twitter, eu não posto quase nada, não vai encher de tweets inúteis.

Programmer, Systems Analyst, IT Director and Entrepreneur from Curitiba, Brazil, living and working in São Paulo, also in Brazil.

Bachelor in Computing Science from Federal University of Paraná since 2007, acting in IT since 1998 as a hobbist.

Additionally, I'm IT Director in a lawyer's company, specialized in labor and provision laws, and drummer of the Brazilian band Hazy (https://www.facebook.com/hazybrasil).

I’m Tom Christiansen, author of Programming Perl and Perl Cookbook from O’Reilly. I work for Grant Street Group, who are always looking to hire more Perl programmers.

I’ve undergraduate degrees in Spanish and in Computer Science, and a graduate degree in compsci focusing on operating systems design and in natural language processing. I’ve studied Spanish, French, Italian, Portuguese, Latin, and German, with a smattering of other languages thrown in. For the last few years I’ve been dabbling in computational linguistics.

row.AboutMe:
I'm a web developer and technology lover with high interest in programing languages, artificial intelligence and software engineering.

Waste my time reading comics and writing about pop culture
Math undergrad student at University of São Paulo.

Sou um web developer fanático por programação, performance de websites e com muita sede de conhecimento. Me descobri profissionalmente aos 14 anos e desde lá não penso em mudar de área.

Atuo no mercado de trabalho desde 2013 e atualmente sou webmaster em uma empresa de marketing, além de dar manutenção nos servidores web e local.

Em 2013 me formei como técnico em informática e em 2014 ingressei na faculdade pelo curso de Ciências da Computação e atualmente curso Sistemas para Internet.

Nas horas vagas atuo como freelancer desenvolvendo projetos voltados no fortalecimento e posicionamento do cliente na internet com foco na performance, usabilidade e compatibilidade dos websites produzidos.

Além disso, participo no desenvolvimento de projetos open-source.

Como nem tudo na vida é trabalho, também sou viciado em World of Warcraft e Heros of the Storm... =P

Ever since my cousin hacked a DOS game and modified the graphics when I was 10 years old, I've been fascinated with computers and software. Since then I've gone to school, excelled in my classes, and have had wonderful opportunities to expose myself to the developer world.

Alongside my passion for software is my passion for my family. After being married for five years, we had our first child, a wonderful little daughter. She has changed my life, and I am currently striving to make it so that the programs that I write and contribute to today will be the ones she can't live without tomorrow.

A qualified chemist who somehow drifted into web development. My favourite programming languages/technologies at the moment are C++ and Node.js. I am also well capable in Java and a few other assorted technologies.
ready to learn something new

Sou consultor no setor de TIC, tenho mais de 20 anos de experiência no setor.

Atuo atualmente ministrando cursos especiais e particulares, em especial com Arduino, porém neste ano de 2015 votei meus estudos e desenvolvimentos na linguagem Java e seus frameworks, somando os conhecimentos adquiridos até em tão.

Também desenvolvo pesquisa em novos projetos para profissionais e empresas, analisando e testando conceitos com Arduino, cada dia mais especializado em microcontroladores AVR e ARM, em especial com a linha produzida pela ATMel

Projetos de Vida

Um dos grandes projetos que tenho de vida é atuar com o social, uma vez que acúmulo certo conhecimento na área tecnologia, vejo que unir os dois campos pode trazer benefícios muito interessante para projetos sociais. Assim busco nas horas vagas também desenvolver meus conhecimentos nesta área, atuando e contribuindo como voluntários em projetos sociais.

Redes Sociais

Nas redes sociais o maior prazer que tenho é contribuir com novas comunidades, ainda mais se eu estiver intimamente ligado ao assunto, sou um forte defensor da Comunidade Arduino em Minas Gerais, também modero diversos grupos criados no Facebook e alguns criados no LinkedIn.

Aqui estou fomentando a criação da comunidade Arduino Brasil

row.AboutMe:
Since I'm too old to start afresh , and my teenage/young-adulthood rebellious nature prevented me from taking advantage of the education I received, I'm trying to make up for lost time, and have some fun along the way, and so I study mathematics mostly by myself with the vast resources that life gives me, namely the internet. =D

This site is really good. I hope it lasts for many years to come. =)
I want to become a great mathematician. For this aim, I'm working hard on this and that, thus I have so much fun!

Community Manager for Stack Exchange since July 2014.

I am a normal human typing with my human hands.

Two Stack Exchange users have earned 25K rep and cast 25K downvotes on the same site.
The other one is Quentin.

What does it mean? It means you're ALIVE, man! Alive and living your part in this crazy improv skit and now you have a new non sequitur to pretend to make sense of for a few minutes until the next one comes along. I woke up and there were two toothpicks next to my coffee grinder. They were there because I had made muffins the other morning, but that's NOT what they MEANT - they meant that I was ALIVE!

If this stuff - the questions, the community - if it starts to get to you that way, take a break. This should be fun; something you do for the love of the topic, of the profession, in hope of building resources that are better than the ones you had to learn from. If it isn't fun any more, stop doing it.

I had to take a break from SO years back for the same reason; I was starting to get really bitter about the people. You see too much crap, too many arguments about crap, too many folks saying things they can't take back over things that have no value.

I walked away for ~6 months. Did some other things. Had fun. And it was fun again when I came back. But if it hadn't been, I wouldn't be here now. And that'd be ok too. Life's too short, too full of unavoidable misery, to waste on misery that can be avoided.

(both quotes: Shog9)
I'm just a coding chipmunk.

All the code snippets I post on Stack Overflow are licensed under CC0, unless otherwise specified.† In short: Free as in free love. Reuse to your heart's content! :-D

(This does not in any way contradict the site policy of licensing everything under CC-Wiki; it simply gives users even more freedom. In particular, you are not obliged to link back to SO when you use my code snippets.)

† This additional CC0 licence applies to my code snippets on Stack Overflow only. It does not apply to other Stack Exchange sites that my profile might happen to get copied to. In particular, I do not grant this licence to my posts on Code Golf Stack Exchange.

Apps that ring a bell

"Power tends to corrupt, and absolute power corrupts absolutely." Lord Acton

"Nearly all men can stand adversity. But if you want to test a man's character - give him power." US President Abraham Lincoln

Nobody heard him, the dead man, but still he lay moaning: I was much further out than you thought. And not waving but drowning. (Stevie Smith)

I'm a Software Engineer with MSc in Computer Science. I currently work in Financial Markets and Banking as a Software and Business Analyst. I have a minor in Computer Engineering, which I completely neglected during college. Now I'm trying to catch up. But mostly I consider myself just a hobbyist trying to teach myself electronics.

Things I like the most in electronics:

  1. To design and etch my own PCBs at home (mostly with thru-role components, with an occasional SMD part to spice things up)
  2. To play with the oscilloscope
  3. To light up LEDs and 7-segment displays
  4. To gut toy RC cars and redo their electronics
  5. To organize my electronics components into neat boxes
  6. To browse questions and answers here at EE.SE and to edit posts to make them shine (when I can, that is, but I'm especially fond of fixing equations formatting using MathJaX)

I'm a Product Manager at Stack Exchange on the Q&A Core team. You can email me at torozco@stackoverflow.com.

But I'm also a Stack Overflow user! My top interests there are:

  • Python
  • Django
  • Software security

In the past, I used python and django to develop a payment solution at MyBee - I'm glad they're still going strong today! I also worked at Scalr as a Product Manager, and at Accenture as a consultant on business / IT projects.

Personal email: thomas@orozco.fr
